content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is how you can define this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all markdown code blocks using regular expressions
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)```", md, seed=1))
    
    # If no matches found, return an empty string
    if isempty(matches) 
        return ""
    end

    # Join all code blocks together with a newline and remove the code fences
    joined_code = join([match[1] for match in matches], "\n")
    return replace(joined_code, "`" => "")
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all instances of Julia language code blocks within your markdown document. It then joins these together with a newline and removes the code fences (the backticks) using the `replace` function. If no matches are found, it returns an empty string.
